default.label: Accredited Investor (Global – using U.S. standard)
default.user_facing_summary: For most countries, Unlocksley uses the U.S. Accredited Investor definition (Regulation D, Rule 501) as the qualification standard.
natural_person_rules: Individual income ≥ USD 200,000 in each of the last 2 years, with expectation of same this year.
Joint income with spouse / partner ≥ USD 300,000 in each of the last 2 years, with expectation of same this year.
Net worth ≥ USD 1,000,000 (individually or jointly), excluding primary residence.
Holds certain professional licenses (e.g. Series 7, 65, or 82) or is a knowledgeable employee of a private fund.
entity_rules: Banks, insurance companies, registered investment companies, business development companies, and similar regulated institutions.
Corporations, partnerships, LLCs, trusts, or family offices with ≥ USD 5,000,000 in assets, not formed solely to acquire this investment.
Certain entities in which all equity owners are Accredited Investors.
default.notes: Used as the default investor qualification standard where no local definition is applied. This is self-attested on Unlocksley.

us.label: Accredited Investor (United States – SEC Regulation D, Rule 501)
us.user_facing_summary: To invest, you must qualify as an Accredited Investor under U.S. securities law (Regulation D, Rule 501).
natural_person_rules: Individual income ≥ USD 200,000 (or joint ≥ USD 300,000) in each of the last 2 years, with expectation of same this year.
Net worth ≥ USD 1,000,000 (alone or with spouse / partner), excluding the value of primary residence.
Holds certain professional licenses or certifications (e.g. Series 7, 65, 82) approved by the SEC.
A 'knowledgeable employee' of a private fund investing in that fund.
entity_rules: Banks, insurance companies, registered investment companies, business development companies, and similar regulated financial institutions.
Corporations, partnerships, LLCs, trusts, or 501(c)(3) organizations with ≥ USD 5,000,000 in assets, not formed just for this investment.
Family offices with ≥ USD 5,000,000 in assets under management and their family clients, meeting SEC requirements.
Any entity with ≥ USD 5,000,000 in investments, or where all equity owners are Accredited Investors.
us.notes: Unlocksley uses this definition for U.S. investors and as the baseline model for global accreditation.

uk.label: High Net Worth / Self-Certified Sophisticated Investor (UK – FCA COBS)
uk.user_facing_summary: UK investors must confirm they are either a High Net Worth Individual or a Self-Certified Sophisticated Investor under FCA rules.
natural_person_rules: High Net Worth: Annual income ≥ GBP 100,000 or net assets ≥ GBP 250,000, as set out in FCA-prescribed statements.
Self-Certified Sophisticated: Meets at least one FCA test (e.g. angel group membership, direct private investments, director of a company with ≥ GBP 1M turnover, or similar experience).
Must sign the FCA investor statement acknowledging reduced regulatory protections and the risks of these investments.
entity_rules: Professional clients under MiFID or per se professional clients under FCA rules are generally eligible.
Corporate or partnership investors may qualify where they meet MiFID/FCA professional client criteria.

references.label: FCA – Self-Certified Sophisticated Investor Statement (COBS 4 Annex 4)

uk.notes: Unlocksley can present the FCA HNW and Sophisticated Investor statements for self-certification by UK investors.

sg.label: Accredited Investor (Singapore – MAS SFA Section 4A)
sg.user_facing_summary: Singapore investors must qualify as Accredited Investors under the Securities and Futures Act (SFA) and related MAS regulations.
natural_person_rules: Net personal assets > SGD 2 million, of which up to SGD 1 million of primary residence value may be counted (subject to MAS guidance).
Financial assets (e.g. deposits, investment products) > SGD 1 million in value.
Income in the preceding 12 months ≥ SGD 300,000.
entity_rules: Corporations with net assets > SGD 10 million.
Trusts and partnerships meeting Accredited Investor criteria under the SFA and Classes of Investors Regulations.
Other entities that qualify as Accredited or Institutional Investors under Singapore law.

references.label: Singapore SFA – Section 4A (Definition of Accredited Investor)
MAS – FAQs on Accredited Investors and Opt-In Process

sg.notes: Unlocksley can use MAS thresholds for Singapore-resident investors and the global default definition for others.

uae.label: Qualified / Professional Investor (UAE – SCA and local regulators)
uae.user_facing_summary: UAE investors generally need to qualify as Professional or Qualified Investors under UAE Securities and Commodities Authority (SCA) and relevant free-zone rules.
natural_person_rules: Meets SCA or relevant regulator tests for knowledge, experience, and financial capacity (e.g. minimum net worth or portfolio size thresholds, as set by local rules).
Often includes individuals accredited or licensed by SCA or another IOSCO-member regulator to perform financial services functions.
May need to opt in to be treated as a Professional/Qualified Investor and acknowledge reduced protections.
entity_rules: Institutional investors and large undertakings meeting SCA/DFSA/FSRA professional client criteria.
Corporates, funds, and financial institutions that satisfy balance sheet, turnover, or assets thresholds defined in local rules.

references.label: SCA – Qualified Investor Amendments (summary – Simmons & Simmons)
UNCTAD – UAE New Qualified Investor Definition (overview)
Standard Chartered UAE – Professional Investor Overview

uae.notes: Details differ between SCA (onshore), DFSA (DIFC) and FSRA (ADGM). For MVP, treat UAE HNW clients as needing professional/qualified investor classification.

eu.label: Professional Client / Professional Investor (EU – MiFID II / AIFMD)
eu.user_facing_summary: EU investors typically invest as Professional Clients under MiFID II or Professional Investors under AIFMD.
natural_person_rules: Individuals generally treated as retail clients unless they opt up to Professional Client status and meet MiFID experience, knowledge and volume tests.
Elective Professionals must satisfy at least two of several criteria (e.g. trade frequency, portfolio size, professional background) as set out in MiFID II.
entity_rules: Per se Professional Clients: regulated firms, large undertakings, institutional investors and certain public bodies.
Elective Professional Clients: other clients who meet MiFID professional tests and opt in.
Professional Investors under AIFMD reference the MiFID Professional Client definition.

references.label: ESMA – MiFID II Annex II: Professional Clients

eu.notes: For MVP, you can either (a) accept EU investors only as Professional Clients via intermediary firms, or (b) apply the global default (Reg D) for direct high-net-worths where local promotion rules permit.

hk.label: Professional Investor (Hong Kong – SFO / Professional Investor Rules)
hk.user_facing_summary: Hong Kong investors generally need to qualify as Professional Investors under the Securities and Futures Ordinance and related rules.
natural_person_rules: Individual: Investment portfolio of at least HKD 8,000,000 (or equivalent in foreign currency).
Portfolio may include securities, deposits and certain other financial assets, including joint accounts and shares of joint portfolios.
entity_rules: Corporation / partnership: Portfolio ≥ HKD 8,000,000 or total assets ≥ HKD 40,000,000.
Trust corporation: Total assets ≥ HKD 40,000,000.
Other categories defined as Professional Investors in SFO and related rules.

references.label: SFC FAQ – Offers of Investments & Professional Investors
Investor and Financial Education Council – Professional Investor Qualification

hk.notes: For HK, treat Professional Investor qualification as the standard; retail investors should not be targeted with private SPV offerings.

au.label: Wholesale / Sophisticated Investor (Australia – Corporations Act / ASIC)
au.user_facing_summary: Australian investors generally participate as Wholesale or Sophisticated Investors under the Corporations Act and ASIC guidance.
natural_person_rules: Has a qualifying accountant’s certificate confirming either: gross income ≥ AUD 250,000 per year for each of the last 2 years; or net assets ≥ AUD 2,500,000.
Alternatively, may qualify under a product value test or as a professional investor (e.g. financial services licensee, certain entities).
entity_rules: Professional investors (e.g. AFSL licensees, regulated funds, large listed entities) as defined in the Corporations Act.
Companies or trusts meeting net asset / income thresholds or product value tests for Wholesale/Sophisticated status.

references.label: ASIC – Certificates Issued by a Qualified Accountant (Wholesale/Sophisticated Investor)

au.notes: Thresholds are under review; for now use current ASIC income and asset criteria.
